reviews.author: italobusi
reviews.body:
I would propose few additional changes either before or after the publication

Also Figure 1 needs to be updated since the WDM end-to-end tunnel and paths start at the same point within the transponder and I guess the two paths are the primary/secondary paths of the same tunnel:

```
                               WDM Tunnel
        <====================================================>
                            WDM Primary Path
        <---------------------------------------------------->

   +----------+                                        +----------+
   |  Flexi-  |                                        |  Flexi-  |
   |   grid   |                                        |   grid   |
   |  node A  |                                        |  node E  |
   |          |        +------+        +------+        |          |
   |          | Link 1 |Flexi-| Link 2 |Flexi-| Link 3 |          |
   |          |<------>| grid |<------>| grid |<------>|          |
   |......... |        |node B|        |node C|        | .........|
   | Trans- : |        +------+        +------+        | : Trans- |
   | ponder : |                                        | : ponder |
   |    A   : |              +----------+              | :    E   |
   |........: |     Link 4   |Flexi-grid|   Link 5     | :........|
   |          |              |    D     |              |          |
   |          |<------------>|   node   |<------------>|          |
   |          |              +----------+              |          |
   +----------+                                        +----------+

        <---------------------------------------------------->
                            WDM Secondary Path

```

comments.body:
This merged model covers also WSON tunnels.

Looking at the abstract of [draft-ietf-teas-yang-te-34](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-ietf-teas-yang-te-34) and [draft-ietf-ccamp-optical-path-computation-yang-02](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-ietf-ccamp-optical-path-computation-yang-02), what about the following abstract:

```suggestion
This document defines a YANG data model for the provisioning and management of Traffic Engineering (TE) tunnels and Label Switched Paths (LSPs) in Optical Networks (Wavelength Switched Optical Networks (WSON) and Flexi-Grid Dense Wavelength Division Multiplexing (DWDM) Networks).
```

If we agree on this abstract, we can open an issue to align the abstract in [draft-ietf-ccamp-optical-path-computation-yang-02](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-ietf-ccamp-optical-path-computation-yang-02)

If they have evolved it would be not from 'current' but from 'previous' or 'traditional'

Moreover, RFC7698 is Informational so better to make it an informational reference to avoid Downref nits

```suggestion
Transport networks have evolved from traditional Wavelength Switched Optical Networks (WSON) systems {{?RFC6163}} towards elastic optical networks,
based on flexi-grid Dense Wavelength Division Multiplexing (DWDM) transmission and switching technologies {{?RFC7698}}. Such technology aims
```

I would also mention RFC9094 since this draft is covering WSON and flexi-grid tunnels:

```suggestion
While {{!RFC9094}} {{!I-D.ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang}} focus on flexi-grid objects such as nodes, transponders
```

Aligned with the abstract to clarify that we are managing both WSON and flexi-grid tunnels

```suggestion
and links, this document presents a YANG {{!RFC7950}} model for the provisioning and management of Traffic Engineering (TE) tunnels and Label Switched Paths (LSPs) in Optical Networks, which can be Wavelength Switched Optical Networks (WSON) networks or Flexi-Grid Dense Wavelength Division Multiplexing (DWDM) Networks or a mix of these two Networks.
```

Better to use WDM instead of flexi-grid:

```suggestion
This document identifies the WDM tunnel components, parameters and their values, and
characterizes the features and the performances of the WDM elements. An application example is
```

I think that the terminology in draft-ietf-teas-yang-te distinguishes between end-to-end and segment:

```suggestion
Each path can be a segment path (only defined by the source and destination nodes or link termination points)
or an end-to-end path (additionally needs source and destination transponders).
```
